articles.author: Steve Holland, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin will not attend what could be the first direct peace talks between Moscow and Kyiv in three years on Thursday, the Kremlin sending instead a group of experienced technocrats.
articles.title: Putin, Trump to skip Ukraine's peace talks that Russian leader proposed

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Andrew Mills, Federico Maccioni
articles.description: UAE leaders hope for U.S. help to make the Gulf nation a global leader in AI.
articles.title: Trump heads to UAE as it hopes to advance AI ambitions

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli military strikes killed at least 60 people in the Gaza Strip, Palestinian medics said, as the United States and Arab mediators pushed for a ceasefire deal and U.S. President Donald Trump visited the Middle East.
articles.title: Israeli military strikes kill scores in Gaza, medics say

articles.author: Mike Stone, David Shepardson, Tim Hepher
articles.description: A Boeing 747 jet offered to President Donald Trump by Qatar as a temporary flying White House might need fighter jet escorts and could be restricted to flying inside the U.S. unless significant costly security upgrades were made, aviation experts and industry sources said.
articles.title: Trump's Qatari 747 may need fighter escorts to serve as Air Force One

articles.author: Andrew Osborn
articles.description: Hawkish anti-Western nationalists are waging a campaign to keep the conflict going.
articles.title: Russian nationalists call for Moscow to fight on in Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Donald Trump said that the United States was getting very close to securing a nuclear deal with Iran, and Tehran had "sort of" agreed to the terms.
articles.title: Trump says U.S. close to a nuclear deal with Iran

articles.author: Jack Queen, Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: Sean “Diddy” Combs' former girlfriend Casandra Ventura will likely face a grueling cross-examination starting on Thursday at the hip-hop mogul's criminal trial, after she accused him of rape and more than a decade of violent abuse.
articles.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs' ex-girlfriend to face cross-examination at hip-hop mogul's criminal trial

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British police arrested U.S. singer Chris Brown on Thursday over an alleged assault at a London nightclub in 2023, the Sun newspaper reported.
articles.title: Singer Chris Brown arrested in UK over alleged 2023 assault

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: A Wisconsin judge pleaded not guilty on Thursday to charges accusing her of helping a migrant evade an arrest outside her courtroom in a case with implications for U.S. President Donald Trump’s sweeping immigration crackdown.
articles.title: Wisconsin judge pleads not guilty to impeding immigrant's arrest

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations said on Thursday it will not take part in a U.S.-backed humanitarian operation in Gaza because it is not impartial, neutral or independent, while Israel pledged to facilitate the effort without being involved in aid deliveries.
articles.title: UN will not take part in US-backed aid effort in Gaza
